column1: Níjar (Spanish pronunciation: [ˈnixaɾ]) is a Spanish municipality in the province of Almería
column2: Andalusia.  It lies in the eastern part of Almería
column3: in the Sierra de Alhamilla and the south-eastern Mediterranean coast
column5: near the famous Cabo de Gata-Níjar Natural Park.

column1: Níjar covers an area of 599.8 square kilometres
column2: making it one of the largest municipalities of Spain. Its population of 17
column3: 824 (2002) is mainly concentrated in the cities of Campohermoso
column5: and Níjar.The main sources of income are in agriculture
column6: especially in the growing of greenhouse crops
column8: especially the watersports centre of San José.
